'''''The Bridge of Catzad-Dum''''' is a text adventure in the ''[[Eamon (video game)|Eamon]]'' series, written by [[Nathan Segerlind]]<ref name="Tolkien Games"/><ref name="El Anillo"/> and released in September 1988. The adventure parodies chapters [[A Journey in the Dark|4]] and [[The Bridge of Khazad-dûm|5]] of Book 2 from ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]'', and is largely adapted from the first story in ''[[wikipedia:The Adventures of Samurai Cat|The Adventures of Samurai Cat]]'', a collection of humorous short stories written by [[Wikipedia:Mark E. Rogers|Mark E. Rogers]].<ref name="Tolkien Games">[http://www.lysator.liu.se/tolkien-games/entry/catzad-dum.html Tolkien Games] (retrieved 4 December 2010)</ref><ref name="El Anillo">[http://www.meristation.com/v3/des_articulo.php?pic=CON&id=2254&idj=&idp=&tipo=art&c=1&pos=5 Meristation, El Anillo interactivo] p. 6 (retrieved 4 December 2010)</ref> In the adventure you journey to Catzad-Dum to avenge the death of your master.<ref name="El Anillo"/>

The title is a parody of "[[The Bridge of Khazad-dûm]]" and the dwarves and orcs of the original story are replaced by cats and "porks".
